chapter.para: You can deploy a &productname; on &caasp; stack on OpenStack. This chapter describes how to deploy a small testing and development instance with one &kube; master and two worker nodes, using Terraform to automate the deployment. This does not create a production deployment, which should be deployed on bare metal for best performance.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: The following prerequisites should be met before attempting to deploy &productname; on OpenStack. The memory and disk space requirements are minimums, and may need to be larger according to your workloads.

listitem.para: 8 GB of memory per &caasp; dashboard and &kube; master nodes
40 GB disk space per &caasp; dashboard and &kube; master nodes
A &suse; Customer Center account for downloading &caasp;. Get SUSE-CaaS-Platform-2.0-KVM-and-Xen.x86_64-1.0.0-GM.qcow2, which has been tested on OpenStack.
Download the openrc.sh file for your OpenStack account

sect1.title: Create a New OpenStack Project
sect1.para: You may use an existing OpenStack project, or run the following commands to create a new project with the necessary configuration for &productname;.
sect1.screen: &prompt.user;openstack project create --domain default --description "CaaS Platform Project" caasp &prompt.user;openstack role add --project caasp --user admin admin
sect1.para: Create an OpenStack network plus a subnet for &caasp; (for example, caasp-net), and add a router to the external (floating) network:
sect1.screen: &prompt.user;openstack network create caasp-net &prompt.user;openstack subnet create caasp_subnet --network caasp-net \ --subnet-range 10.0.2.0/24 &prompt.user;openstack router create caasp-net-router &prompt.user;openstack router set caasp-net-router --external-gateway floating &prompt.user;openstack router add subnet caasp-net-router caasp_subnet
sect1.para: Upload your &caasp; image to your OpenStack account:
Create a security group with the rules needed for &caasp;:
sect1.screen: &prompt.user;openstack security group create cap --description "Allow CAP traffic" &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol any --dst-port any --ethertype IPv4 --egress &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol any --dst-port any --ethertype IPv6 --egress &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol tcp --dst-port 20000:20008 --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol tcp --dst-port 443:443 --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol tcp --dst-port 2793:2793 --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol tcp --dst-port 4443:4443 --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol tcp --dst-port 80:80 --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0 &prompt.user;openstack security group rule create cap --protocol tcp --dst-port 2222:2222 --remote-ip 0.0.0.0/0
sect1.para: Clone the Terraform script from GitHub:
Edit the openstack.tfvars file. Use the names of your OpenStack objects, for example:
sect1.screen: image_name = "SUSE-CaaS-Platform-2.0" internal_net = "caasp-net" external_net = "floating" admin_size = "m1.large" master_size = "m1.large" masters = 1 worker_size = "m1.xlarge" workers = 2

sect1.title: Deploy &productname;
sect1.para: Source your openrc.sh file, set the project, and deploy &caasp;:
Wait for a few minutes until all systems are up and running, then view your installation:
Add your cap security group to all &caasp; workers:
sect1.screen: &prompt.user;openstack server add security group caasp-worker0 cap &prompt.user;openstack server add security group caasp-worker1 cap
sect1.para: If you need to log into your new nodes, log in as root using the SSH key in the automation/caasp-openstack-terraform/ssh directory.

sect1.title: Bootstrapping &productname;
sect1.para: The following examples use the xip.io wildcard DNS service. You may use your own DNS/DHCP services that you have set up in OpenStack in place of xip.io.
For more information about networking requirements, see .

listitem.para: Point your browser to the IP address of the &caasp; admin node, and create a new admin user login
Check the Install Tiller checkbox, then click the Next button
Terraform automatically creates all of your worker nodes, according to the number you configured in openstack.tfvars, so click Next to skip Bootstrap your CaaS Platform
On the Select nodes and roles screen click Accept all nodes, click to define your master and worker nodes, then click Next
For the External Kubernetes API FQDN, use the public (floating) IP address of the &caasp; master and append the .xip.io domain suffix
For the External Dashboard FQDN use the public (floating) IP address of the &caasp; admin node, and append the .xip.io domain suffix
